title: Take a snapshot of the suite
content:
As a system administrator, you may need to take a snapshot of the SMA suite before you perform some system level tasks such as suite backup or upgrade.

To take a snapshot of your suite, follow these steps:

  1. Shut down the SMA suite by running the following commands on a control plane node: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/scripts
./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l DOWN -n <namespace>

    Where: <namespace> is the suite namespace, and the runlevel setting uses a lowercase letter L. Make a note of the suite namespace as you will need it when restarting the suite later.

    You can use the global option -f to show more logs during the stop process.

  2. Run the following script on worker nodes: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
./kube-stop.sh
  3. Run the following script on the control plane nodes: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
./kube-stop.sh
  4. Shut down the control plane and worker nodes.
  5. Take a snapshot for all control plane and worker nodes.
  6. Start the control plane and worker nodes.
  7. Run the following commands on all control plane nodes concurrently. When you have finished starting all control plane nodes, run the same commands on all worker nodes concurrently: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
./kube-start.sh
  8. Start the SMA suite by running the following commands on a control plane node: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/scripts
./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l UP -n <namespace>

    Where: <namespace> is the suite namespace.

    You can use the global option -f to show more logs during the start process.
